name: Rum Jungle Bungalows

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent a night at the Rum Jungle Bungalows after a busy day exploring the Litchfield National Park, the property is well maintained and with only a small number of bungalows it's guaranteed to be nice and quiet, infact from what we could tell, all but one of the rooms were occupied and we bearly heard a sound!!!
reviews.title: Relaxing and peaceful after a day of exploring!!

reviews.text: The BBQ area offers a good alternative to dining out, mozzie coils and cooking utensils are all supplied!! The BBQ is surronded by lovely gardens with citronella garden lights - unfortunately they hadn't been refilled after guests used them the night before as they would really add to the atmosphere.
reviews.title: A great base for exploring Litchfield National Park

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was not available during our stay, but juding by some of the other reviews it is a great experience and well worth it - might be a good excuse for a return visit!!
reviews.title: Gorgeous Rooms
different!!
reviews.text: I have also read a number of comments about the size of the bungalows - the bathroom area is small but we actually commented that the remainder of the room was actually suprisingly spacious!! They rooms are nicely appointed and kept clean!! Having a fridge and in room tea / coffee facilities was also appreciated.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We (myself, husband and 11 year old son) recently spent two nights at the Rum Jungle Bungalows using it as a base to explore Litchfield National Park and surrounds. Yes, the bungalows are quite small but you do not visit this part of the world to spend all day inside!! Ours was clean, comfortable and most important, air-conditioned. The pool was a welcome relief from the heat and the grounds peaceful and relaxing. Breakfast (optional) was a tasty treat of local goodies and provided a healthy start to the day. Sue, the owner, provided us with some great tips and information on the local area and couldn't have been more helpful. Next door is the Butterfly Farm and Cafe which is a colourful and relaxed place for drinks and dinner. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay!
reviews.title: Breakfast?

description: Rum Jungle Bungalows, peaceful and serene: it's simply gorgeous! A green and leafy oasis in the Dry Season - a cool and lush retreat from the heat in the Wet! On the edge of the historic, picturesque township of Batchelor, known as the gateway to Litchfield National Park. Just six beautifully appointed little bungalow-style rooms set on an acre of lush tropical & native gardens, bounded by natural bushland. Just right for a relaxing break on your travels or an ideal base to explore Litchfield National Park. Rum Jungle Bungalows is a perfect place to celebrate special occasions, or a peaceful getaway for a couple of days just an hour's drive from Darwin.
